author: anon.
contents:
Flesh side: groups of words divided into syllables, the words belonging to the second group end in -ia; those in the third group could end either in -ia or -eia. The words of both groups consist of 5 syllables. Hair side: groups of words of 5 syllables ending in -ia, but not clearly divided into syllables (only the first syllable of each word is written separately).
Words are somewhat rare.
statepreservation: fragment of a parchment codex, broken off on all sides; each side preserves the remains of 8 lines arranged in a single column of writing (maximum preserved width coincides with that of the piece itself). No margins have been preserved, with the exception of a minimal right-hand margin of 0.15-0.3 cm on the flesh side.
lectionalsigns: Syllables separated by blank spaces on the flesh side; on the hair side, only the first syllable of each word is separated by a blank space from the rest. Both sides are divided by horizontal lines to groups of 4 lines. Possible gemination of ?.
hand: Biblical majuscule of medium size: formal bookhand; a school manual.
